result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Memo to Attorneys that case has been renumbered. Documents to be filed in the new case# 22CM88.

2:10 PM Defendant Christine Rae Carrico in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Christine Rae Carrico.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Atty Raabe states that the case is filed as a felony but the charges are not felonies but misdemeanor.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Atty Raabe stands mute to the pleas.
Not guilty pleas are entered.

BY THE COURT:  Signature Bond continued. 

**CASE IS A MISDEMEANOR**
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Christine Rae Carrico
Current: 2859 Chestnut Dr, Plover, WI 54467   (Effective: 03-01-2022)
Prior: 2859 Chestnut Dr 871, Plover, WI 54467

02:45 PM Defendant Christine Rae Carrico not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court questions if service was obtained.  There was a bail hearing.
Atty Mutchler requests a warrant with a $250 cash alternative.

BY THE COURT: 
Criminal warrant with a $250 cash alternative.
Initial Appearance set for February 21, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1

1:03 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Attempted Retail Theft - Intentionally Take and Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation at this time.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $300 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court adopts the $300 signature bond as recommended by the State with conditions as stated on the record.

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  February 21, 2022  @ 2:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
No contact or be on the premises of the Walmart in Plover
